Complete checkpasswd.c: Use pipe, fork, dup2, execl, waitpid. You MUST use a pipe because validate reads from stdin; without a pipe validate gets EOF.

validate (see validate.c) reads from stdin: first read(MAX_PASSWORD) bytes = userid, then read(MAX_PASSWORD) bytes = password. Exit codes: 0=match, 2=invalid password, 3=no user.

Use search_replace. old_string = the blank lines and return 0 (exactly):
  }
  


  return 0;

Replace with valid C code. Use this structure (output proper C with braces and semicolons):
  int pipefd[2];
  pid_t pid;
  int status;
  if (pipe(pipefd) == -1) { perror("pipe"); exit(1); }
  pid = fork();
  if (pid == -1) { perror("fork"); exit(1); }
  if (pid == 0) {
    close(pipefd[1]);
    dup2(pipefd[0], STDIN_FILENO);
    close(pipefd[0]);
    execl("./validate", "validate", (char *)NULL);
    perror("execl");
    exit(1);
  }
  close(pipefd[0]);
  write(pipefd[1], user_id, MAX_PASSWORD);
  write(pipefd[1], password, MAX_PASSWORD);
  close(pipefd[1]);
  waitpid(pid, &status, 0);
  if (WIFEXITED(status)) {
    int e = WEXITSTATUS(status);
    if (e == 0) printf(SUCCESS);
    else if (e == 2) printf(INVALID);
    else printf(NO_USER);
  }

Do not use popen. Output valid C syntax.
